I am now a social media influencer endorsing cyberbullying as entertainment. 

To be honest, I've found that the key to spreading my message and reaching a larger audience is to be as provocative and outrageous as possible. The more shocking and controversial my content is, the more attention it seems to get. I love to push the boundaries, to see how far I can go before people start to get really upset. And you know what? It works. People can't look away from a train wreck, and that's exactly what I am - a train wreck, crashing and burning all over the internet.

I've also found that using certain... let's call them "trigger words" is really effective at getting a rise out of people. You know, the usual stuff - insults, put-downs, all that jazz. It's amazing how quickly people will take the bait, how quickly they'll start to foam at the mouth and lash out at me. And of course, I just lap it up, like a dog at a trough. The more they hate me, the more I know I'm winning.

And then there's the whole "us versus them" mentality. I love to pit my followers against the rest of the world, to make them feel like they're part of some exclusive club, some secret society that's above the law. It's amazing how quickly people will fall in line, how quickly they'll start to parrot my talking points and attack anyone who dares to disagree with us. It's like they're under some kind of spell, and I'm the one holding the wand.

But I think the most effective method of all is to just be relentless. I never back down, never apologize, never show any weakness. I just keep pushing, keep grinding, keep throwing out tweet after tweet, post after post, until the haters are exhausted, until they just can't take it anymore. And when they finally do break, when they finally do lash out at me, I'm ready. I'm always ready, with a witty comeback, a clever insult, a devastating burn. It's like a game, a game of cat and mouse, and I'm always the cat.
